00:00:01:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:01:080000.Dialogue: So two years later, there's a knock on the door. Guy opens it, and there on his porch is the snail, who says, "What the heck was all that about?"

00:00:13:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:13:070000.Dialogue: Well, see, it took two years for the snail to... Not important.

00:00:22:200000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:00:22:200000.Dialogue: - Can I ask you a question?

00:00:25:130000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:00:25:130000.Dialogue: Where do you think this is going?

00:00:28:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:28:200000.Dialogue: To be honest, I was hoping at least second base.

00:00:38:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:38:060000.Dialogue: A Jewish stand-up comedian, that'd be new.

00:00:42:040000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:00:42:040000.Dialogue: Actually, I think a lot of them are Jewish.

00:00:46:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:46:070000.Dialogue: No, I was just... Never mind.

00:00:50:070000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:00:50:070000.Dialogue: Look, Howard, this is our third date and we both know what that means.

00:01:02:070000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:01:02:070000.Dialogue: But I need to know whether you're looking for a relationship or a one-night stand.

00:01:07:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:07:210000.Dialogue: Okay, just to be clear: there's only one correct answer, right?

00:01:12:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:12:170000.Dialogue: It's not like "chicken or fish" on an airplane?

00:01:15:120000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:01:15:120000.Dialogue: Maybe you need to think about it a little.

00:01:17:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:17:180000.Dialogue: You know, it's not unheard of for a one-night stand to turn into a relationship.

00:01:25:160000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:01:25:160000.Dialogue: Call me when you figure it out.

00:01:46:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:46:220000.Dialogue: Why are you back from your date so early?

00:01:49:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:49:110000.Dialogue: In romance, as in show business, always leave them wanting more.

00:02:26:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:26:020000.Dialogue: Hey, did either of you guys know that three dates with the same woman is the threshold for sex?

00:02:31:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:31:110000.Dialogue: Actually, I've never had three dates with the same woman.

00:02:35:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:35:100000.Dialogue: With Penny and me, it took two years. Now that I think about it, that was three dates.

00:02:42:010000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:42:010000.Dialogue: Okay, well, before you and Penny hooked up, did she ask for any kind of commitment?

00:02:47:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:47:080000.Dialogue: No, she was pretty clear about wanting to keep her options open.

00:02:52:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:52:070000.Dialogue: I have something to announce, but out of respect for convention, I will wait for you to finish your current conversation. What are you talking about?

00:03:00:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:00:140000.Dialogue: The cultural paradigm in which people have sex after three dates.

00:03:04:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:04:020000.Dialogue: I see. Now, are we talking "date", the social interaction, or "date", the dried fruit?

00:03:14:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:14:220000.Dialogue: Oh, good, my turn. Well, this is very exciting and I wanted you to be among the first to know...

00:03:19:110000.Speaker: Kripke
00:03:19:110000.Dialogue: Hey, Cooper. I hear you're going to be on the radio with Ira Flatow from Science Friday next week.

00:03:23:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:23:160000.Dialogue: Thank you, Kripke, for depriving me of the opportunity to share my news with my friends.

00:03:35:180000.Speaker: Kripke
00:03:35:180000.Dialogue: Let me ask you a question: At what point did National Public Radio have to start scraping the bottom of the barrel for its guests? Don't answer. It's rhetorical.

00:03:47:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:47:070000.Dialogue: Why are you such a stupid head?

00:03:55:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:55:050000.Dialogue: I'm sorry you had to hear that.

00:03:57:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:57:160000.Dialogue: Are you really going to be on NPR?

00:03:59:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:59:190000.Dialogue: Yes, they're interviewing me by phone from my office, regarding the recent so-called "discovery" of magnetic monopoles in spin-ices. It's pledge week and they're trying to goose the ratings with a little controversy.

00:04:14:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:14:030000.Dialogue: Thank you. My mother is very excited. She's convening her Bible study group to listen in, and then pray for my soul.

00:04:22:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:22:170000.Dialogue: I was on the radio once. I called in to Fever 104 FM New Delhi and was the fourth person to say the phrase that pays: "Fever 104, aajke naye acchha sangeetka ghar".

00:04:34:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:34:060000.Dialogue: That means: "Fever 104, home of the really good current music".

00:04:45:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:45:150000.Dialogue: All right. These are the talking points for my NPR interview tomorrow. I need to make sure that they're simple enough for the less educated in the audience to understand. Howard, look this over and tell me what's unclear to you.

00:05:00:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:00:160000.Dialogue: Excuse me, I have a master's degree in engineering from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. It required the completion of 144 units of grad work and an original thesis.

00:05:09:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:09:130000.Dialogue: Yes. Look this over and tell me what's unclear to you.

00:05:16:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:16:150000.Dialogue: You know, when Sheldon gives you homework, you don't have to do it.

00:05:20:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:20:070000.Dialogue: In fact, it's better if you don't, otherwise it makes the rest of us look bad.

00:05:37:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:37:140000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, just screwing with you.

00:05:42:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:42:040000.Dialogue: Hey, Howard, why haven't you called Bernadette?

00:05:46:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:46:070000.Dialogue: Yeah, she said she hasn't heard from you in a week. I thought you liked her.

00:05:49:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:49:050000.Dialogue: I do, but she wants a commitment and I'm not sure she's my type.

00:05:54:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:54:000000.Dialogue: She agreed to go out with you for free. What more do you need?

00:05:57:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:57:080000.Dialogue: Look, Bernadette is really nice. I just always thought when I finally settle down into a relationship, it would be with someone, you know, different.

00:06:07:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:07:120000.Dialogue: Well, you know, more like Megan Fox from Transformers.

00:06:12:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:12:120000.Dialogue: Or Katee Sackhoff from Battlestar Galactica.

00:06:19:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:19:040000.Dialogue: You'd have a better shot with the three-breasted Martian hooker from Total Recall.

00:06:24:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:24:110000.Dialogue: Okay, now you're just being unrealistic.

00:06:28:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:28:020000.Dialogue: Anyway, that movie was like 20 years ago. Imagine how saggy those things would be.

00:06:35:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:35:180000.Dialogue: Howard, you're going to throw away a great girl like Bernadette because you're holding out for some ridiculous fantasy?

00:06:41:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:41:140000.Dialogue: Hey, just because you settled doesn't mean I have to.

00:06:50:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:50:050000.Dialogue: Hey, I did not settle for Leonard. I mean, obviously, he isn't the kind of guy I usually go out with... you know, physically.

00:07:02:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:02:090000.Dialogue: My point is, I do not judge a book by its cover. I am interested in the person underneath.

00:07:06:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:06:040000.Dialogue: I am here, right? You see me.

00:07:13:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:13:200000.Dialogue: Hey, I'm interested in what's inside people, too, but why is it wrong to want those insides wrapped up in, say, the delicious caramel that is Halle Berry?

00:07:34:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:34:160000.Dialogue: All right, you know what, I will tell you - why it's wrong...

00:07:38:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:38:160000.Dialogue: Biologically speaking, Howard is perfectly justified in seeking out the optimum mate for the propagation of his genetic line.

00:07:54:080000.Scene: Kripke is in a storage cupboard of some kind. He has tubes rigged up through the roof attached to helium tanks which he is turning on. The radio is playing.
00:07:54:080000.Speaker: Radio
00:07:54:080000.Dialogue: This is Ira Flatow and you're listening to NPR's Science Friday. Joining us today by phone from his office in Pasadena, California is Dr. Sheldon Cooper.

00:08:05:150000.Scene: Kripke is in a storage cupboard of some kind. He has tubes rigged up through the roof attached to helium tanks which he is turning on. The radio is playing.
00:08:05:150000.Speaker: Kripke
00:08:05:150000.Dialogue: Oh, this is going to be a riot.

00:08:10:210000.Scene: Kripke is in a storage cupboard of some kind. He has tubes rigged up through the roof attached to helium tanks which he is turning on. The radio is playing.
00:08:10:210000.Speaker: Radio
00:08:10:210000.Dialogue: Thanks for being with us today, Dr. Cooper.

00:08:12:220000.Scene: Kripke is in a storage cupboard of some kind. He has tubes rigged up through the roof attached to helium tanks which he is turning on. The radio is playing.
00:08:12:220000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:08:15:150000.Scene: Kripke is in a storage cupboard of some kind. He has tubes rigged up through the roof attached to helium tanks which he is turning on. The radio is playing.
00:08:15:150000.Speaker: Ira
00:08:15:150000.Dialogue: Now, let's talk about magnetic monopoles. Can you explain to our audience just what a monopole is?

00:08:22:150000.Scene: Kripke is in a storage cupboard of some kind. He has tubes rigged up through the roof attached to helium tanks which he is turning on. The radio is playing.
00:08:22:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:22:150000.Dialogue: Of course. First, consider an ordinary magnet which has, as even the most uneducated in your audience must know, two poles.

00:08:34:150000.Scene: Kripke is in a storage cupboard of some kind. He has tubes rigged up through the roof attached to helium tanks which he is turning on. The radio is playing.
00:08:34:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:34:150000.Dialogue: A north and south pole. If you cut that in half, you have two smaller magnets, each with its own north and south pole.

00:08:44:010000.Scene: Kripke is in a storage cupboard of some kind. He has tubes rigged up through the roof attached to helium tanks which he is turning on. The radio is playing.
00:08:44:010000.Speaker: Ira
00:08:44:010000.Dialogue: Uh, Dr. Cooper, I think there might be something wrong with our connection.

00:08:48:130000.Scene: Kripke is in a storage cupboard of some kind. He has tubes rigged up through the roof attached to helium tanks which he is turning on. The radio is playing.
00:08:48:130000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:08:51:230000.Scene: Kripke is in a storage cupboard of some kind. He has tubes rigged up through the roof attached to helium tanks which he is turning on. The radio is playing.
00:08:51:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:51:230000.Dialogue: As I was saying, an ordinary magnet has two poles. The primary characteristic of a monopole is that it has only one pole, hence, monopole.

00:09:03:190000.Scene: Kripke is in a storage cupboard of some kind. He has tubes rigged up through the roof attached to helium tanks which he is turning on. The radio is playing.
00:09:03:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:03:190000.Dialogue: A requirement for string theory, or M-theory, if you will, is the existence of such monopoles. I, myself, led an expedition to the Arctic Circle in search of said particles. Kripke, I found the nozzle! I'm going to kill you!

00:09:23:190000.Scene: Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
00:09:23:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:23:190000.Dialogue: So nice you could join me this evening. You're looking lovely as always.

00:09:29:140000.Scene: Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
00:09:29:140000.Speaker: Katee
00:09:29:140000.Dialogue: Thanks, Howard. Always nice to be part of your masturbatory fantasies.

00:09:35:190000.Scene: Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
00:09:35:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:35:190000.Dialogue: Come on, Katee. Don't make it sound so cheap.

00:09:38:180000.Scene: Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
00:09:38:180000.Speaker: Katee
00:09:38:180000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, fiddling with yourself in the bathtub is a real class act.

00:09:45:030000.Scene: Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
00:09:45:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:45:030000.Dialogue: Thank you. So, shall we get started?

00:09:50:170000.Scene: Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
00:09:50:170000.Speaker: Katee
00:09:50:170000.Dialogue: Sure. But can I ask you a question first?

00:09:54:110000.Scene: Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
00:09:54:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:54:110000.Dialogue: Do you want to play Cylon and colonist?

00:09:56:220000.Scene: Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
00:09:56:220000.Speaker: Katee
00:09:56:220000.Dialogue: No. I want to know why you're playing make-believe with me when you could be out with a real woman tonight.

00:10:02:010000.Scene: Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
00:10:02:010000.Speaker: Howard

00:10:04:040000.Scene: Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
00:10:04:040000.Speaker: Katee
00:10:04:040000.Dialogue: No, I mean Princess Leia. Of course I mean Bernadette. She's a wonderful girl and she really likes you.

00:10:11:040000.Scene: Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
00:10:11:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:11:040000.Dialogue: I know, but she's not you.

00:10:13:230000.Scene: Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
00:10:13:230000.Speaker: Katee

00:10:17:050000.Scene: Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
00:10:17:050000.Speaker: Katee
00:10:17:050000.Dialogue: The real me is in Beverly Hills going out with a tall, handsome, rich guy.

00:10:20:010000.Scene: Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
00:10:20:010000.Speaker: Howard

00:10:21:070000.Scene: Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
00:10:21:070000.Speaker: Howard

00:10:23:230000.Scene: Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
00:10:23:230000.Speaker: Katee
00:10:23:230000.Dialogue: The point is, you've got a wonderful girl in your life, and you're ignoring her in order to spend your nights in the bathtub with a mental image and a wash cloth.

00:10:34:040000.Scene: Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
00:10:34:040000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:10:34:040000.Dialogue: Howard! What are you doing in there?

00:10:38:020000.Scene: Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
00:10:38:020000.Speaker: Howard

00:10:40:010000.Scene: Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
00:10:40:010000.Speaker: Howard’s Mother
00:10:40:010000.Dialogue: I hope that's all you're doing! We share that tub!

00:10:46:150000.Scene: Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
00:10:46:150000.Speaker: Howard

00:10:51:110000.Scene: Howard’s bathroom. He is in the bath.
00:10:51:110000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:51:110000.Dialogue: Oh, man. All soaped up and no place to go.

00:11:05:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:05:190000.Dialogue: I was humiliated on national radio. How do you think I'm doing?

00:11:09:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:09:130000.Dialogue: Come on, it wasn't that bad.

00:11:13:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:13:020000.Dialogue: We represent the Lollipop Guild, and we want you.

00:11:22:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:22:030000.Dialogue: Okay, so Kripke played a joke on you.

00:11:37:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:37:120000.Dialogue: All right, he got you. You can get him back.

00:11:40:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:40:140000.Dialogue: I refuse to sink to his level.

00:11:42:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:42:200000.Dialogue: You can't sink. With all that helium in you, you're lucky you don't float away.

00:11:55:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:55:010000.Dialogue: However, on an unrelated topic, I am never getting out of this bed again.

00:11:59:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:59:040000.Dialogue: What if you could make Kripke look even sillier than he made you look?

00:12:03:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:03:050000.Dialogue: I don't think that's possible, dude.

00:12:05:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:05:190000.Dialogue: I didn't come to help, I came to mock.

00:12:10:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:10:030000.Dialogue: Sheldon, what you need to do is figure out a way to exact vengeance on Kripke, like, uh, like, how the Joker got back at Batman for putting him - in the Arkham Asylum for the Criminally Insane.

00:12:18:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:18:200000.Dialogue: - That's true. He didn't just stay there and talk about his feelings with the other psychotic villains. He, he broke out and poisoned Gotham's water supply.

00:12:30:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:30:110000.Dialogue: Well... - I suppose I could poison Kripke.

00:12:34:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:34:100000.Dialogue: - It's a simple matter. There are several toxic chemicals that'd be untraceable in an autopsy.

00:12:41:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:41:110000.Dialogue: Okay, uh, that's the spirit, but, um, let's dial it back to a non-lethal form of vengeance.

00:12:49:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:49:100000.Dialogue: Oh! How about we put a whoopee cushion on his office chair?

00:12:56:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:56:010000.Dialogue: He'll sit down, it'll sound like he's flatulent, even though he's not.

00:13:07:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:07:070000.Dialogue: Oh, gee, you're too late. Scarlett Johansson and Wonder Woman were just in here trolling around for neurotic, little weasels.

00:13:14:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:14:090000.Dialogue: I came to talk to Bernadette. She's working today, right?

00:13:17:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:17:060000.Dialogue: Yes, but I don't think she wants to see you.

00:13:20:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:20:200000.Dialogue: Come on, Howard. You hurt her feelings by not calling her all week. Plus, I've kind of been talkin' some smack about ya.

00:13:29:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:29:090000.Dialogue: Wait, Bernadette, I need to talk to you.

00:13:32:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:32:160000.Dialogue: This will only take a second. You asked me to think about where our relationship was going, and I did. Bernadette?

00:13:49:180000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:13:49:180000.Dialogue: Is this more comedy that I don't understand?

00:13:53:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:53:020000.Dialogue: No. I'm serious. I'm never going to find another girl like you who likes me and is, you know, real.

00:14:09:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:09:230000.Dialogue: I prefer to think of myself as quirky.

00:14:13:110000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:14:13:110000.Dialogue: Howard, we've only been on three dates. We haven't even had sex yet.

00:14:25:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:25:200000.Dialogue: Don't you just hate it when this happens?

00:14:34:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:34:040000.Dialogue: All right, how's this for revenge? A solution of hydrogen peroxide, and one of saturated potassium iodide.

00:14:49:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:49:220000.Dialogue: Ahh, refreshing. Now, we're going to combine these chemicals with ordinary dish soap, creating a little exothermic release of oxygen.

00:15:14:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:14:050000.Dialogue: This is brilliant, Sheldon. How are we going to deploy it in Kripke's office?

00:15:18:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:18:100000.Dialogue: Already taken care of. Observe. This is a live shot of Kripke's lab via a mini webcam I was able to install, thanks to a dollar bill discreetly placed in the night janitor's shirt pocket. At the same time, I also secured large quantities of these chemicals above the tiles in the drop ceiling.

00:15:38:000000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:38:000000.Dialogue: Oh, Sheldon, you remind me of a young Lex Luthor.

00:15:46:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:46:150000.Dialogue: - Let me guess: motion sensors? - Yes.

00:15:48:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:48:220000.Dialogue: The reaction will be triggered when Kripke reaches the center of the room. Mwah, ha, ha.

00:15:57:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:57:160000.Dialogue: I gotta say, I am really impressed. This is truly the Sheldon Cooper way to get even.

00:16:08:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:08:190000.Dialogue: It may be low-tech, but I still maintain the whoopee cushion has comic validity.

00:16:18:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:16:18:090000.Dialogue: I believe that's the president of the university.

00:16:21:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:21:060000.Dialogue: And the board of directors. Abort! Abort!

00:16:24:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:16:24:040000.Dialogue: How could you not put in an "abort?"

00:16:25:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:25:170000.Dialogue: I made a boo-boo, all right?

00:16:28:030000.Speaker: Kripke
00:16:28:030000.Dialogue: I think the board will really appreciate how well we're using that NSA grant, President Seibert. Right here we have a micro-controlled plasma...

00:16:42:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:16:42:170000.Dialogue: Wow. Looks like the Ganges on laundry day.

00:16:48:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:48:130000.Dialogue: At least they don't know it was you.

00:16:53:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:53:050000.Dialogue: This classic prank comes to you from the malevolent mind of Sheldon Cooper. If you'd like to see the look on your stupid face, this video is being instantly uploaded to YouTube. Oh, and a hat tip to Leonard Hofstadter and Raj Koothrappali for their support and encouragement in this enterprise.

00:17:17:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:17:17:130000.Dialogue: Well, I'm going back to India. What's your plan?

00:17:25:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:25:170000.Dialogue: Hey, here's your tip from table seven.

00:17:34:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:34:020000.Dialogue: You want me to throw him out?

00:17:37:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:37:030000.Dialogue: Are you sure? He's small. I bet I can get a nice, tight spiral on him.

00:17:43:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:17:43:150000.Dialogue: I want to dedicate this number to a great gal who I've done wrong.
